Variance function regression + decomposition of the variance and sq. coefficient of variation

Source: R/ineqx.R
ineqx.Rd

The ineqx package implements Rosche (2021). [...]

ineqx(
  x = NULL,
  t = NULL,
  y,
  ystat = "CV2",
  groupvar = NULL,
  timevar = NULL,
  ref = NULL,
  controls = NULL,
  weights = NULL,
  AME_mu = NULL,
  AME_sigma = NULL,
  dat
)

Arguments

x

Character string. Treatment variable. Values must be binary (0/1)
t

Character string. Before/after variable. Values must be binary (0/1)
y

Character string. Dependent variable. Can only be c.x
ystat

Character string. Either "Var" or "CV2". Choose to analyze the effect of x on the variance or squared coefficient of variation
groupvar

Character string. Must be i.x. Grouping variable to decompose variance into within- and between-group components.
timevar

Character string. c.x with specify penalized splines, i.x will specify dummies. Time variable to analyze change over time.
ref

Number, vector, or list. Counterfactual reference point. See details.
controls

Character vector with additional control variables. E.g. c("c.age", "i.sex", ...)
weights

Character string. Weight variable.
AME_mu

Dataframe with average marginal effects (Mu)
AME_sigma

Dataframe with average marginal effects (Sigma)
dat

Dataframe

Value

List with six elements: pred_mu, pred_sigma, dW, dB, dD, dT. See details.

Details

The main function of ineqx. [...]

Counterfactual reference point (ref)

ref can either be a number, c(number, "variable name"), or list(n=c(...), mu=c(...), sigma=c(...), beta=c(...), lambda=c(...)). [...]

Return

...

Author

Benjamin Rosche <benjamin.rosche@gmail.com>

Examples

data(incdat)
decomp1 <- ineqx()

#> Error in dissectVar(y, cicheck = "c"): argument "y" is missing, with no default
